original: Huggert, Erik Walter, gatuchef, Göteborg, f. 10/9/86 i Odensvi, Västmanl. 1. G. 14 m. Victoria Börjeson. Barn : Arne f. 15, ’leg. läk., Stig 17, civ :ing., anst. v. SJ, Gunnel 22, gymn:dir., g. m. gymn:dir. Sixten Thorslund, Sthlm. — CTL (VoV) 04-09. Ing. v. A-B Skånska Cementgjut. i Gbg 09-11, bitr. ing. v. gatu- o. vägförvaltn. i Gbg 11-20, byråing. där 20-45, gatuchef sed. 46. Lär. v. Slöjdfören. sk. i Gbg 11-33, assiist. v. CTH 26-33, spec:lär. i vattenbyggn. där sed. 33. Skr.: bl. a. Gator o. vägar i Gbg samt Avlopps-ledn. i Gbg (Gbgsboken 23). RVO, FMM.
translated: Huggert, Erik Walter, street chief in Gothenburg, born on September 10, 1886 in Odensvi, Västmanland. First marriage in 1914 with Victoria Börjeson, with whom he had three children: Arne, born in 1915, a licensed physician; Stig, born in 1917, civil engineer employed by SJ; and Gunnel, born in 1922, a gymnasium director who married Sixten Thorslund, a gymnasium director in Stockholm. Erik worked as an engineer for AB Skånska Cementgjuteriet in Gothenburg from 1909-1911, assistant engineer for the street and road department in Gothenburg from 1911-1920, bureau engineer there from 1920-1945, and street chief from 1946. He was a teacher at the Handicraft Association school in Gothenburg from 1911-1933, assistant at Chalmers University of Technology from 1926-1933, and a special teacher in hydraulic engineering from 1933. He wrote, among other things, about Streets and Roads in Gothenburg and Sewage Lines in Gothenburg (Göteborgsboken 1923). He was awarded the Swedish Royal Order of the Polar Star and the Finnish Military Merit Cross.

affiliation.name: Street and Road Department in Gothenburg
